#Text=Arad ( Israel )
#Text=Arad (
#Text=Hebrew , ערד ) is a small city in Israel that lies on the border between the Negev desert and the Judaean Desert .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Tel Arad , the site of the ancient city of Arad , is located some 10 km west of the modern city centre .
#Text=Arad is a great centre for hiking and exploring the northeastern part of the Negev desert .

#Text=Modern Arad was founded in 1962 by young Israelis , most of them ex-kibbutzniks and ex-moshavniks , who were seeking an environment free of the urban ills of overcrowding , traffic , noise and pollution .
#Text=Although not noted for its great beauty , the town 's growth has closely followed a well-designed master plan .
#Text=Arad 's present population is approximately 28,000 ( 2003 estimate ) and reflects the broad spectrum of Israeli society with a special emphasis on recent immigrants .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Take a bus from Beer Sheva .
#Text=There are also less frequent buses from Tel Aviv , Jerusalem and other cities .
#Text=Check the schedule for those ahead of time .
#Text=From Beer Sheva
#Text=From the Beer Sheva central bus station , line 386 ( express ) , 387 ( direct ) and line 388 ( higher frequency , but more intermediate stops ) run to Arad .
#Text=The price is ₪8.70 .
#Text=From Tel Aviv
#Text=From Tel Aviv ( Arlozorov terminal only ) , lines 389 and 421 run to Arad .
#Text=Each line has only 2-3 trips per day each direction .
#Text=Line 421 continues to the Dead Sea .
#Text=In addition , line 550 runs from Bnei Brak to Arad , approximately 9 times per day .
#Text=From Jerusalem
#Text=From Jerusalem , lines 554 and 555 run to Arad .
#Text=These lines are oriented to the Haredi sector , so they start in Haredi neighborhoods rather than the central bus station .
#Text=Together these lines have about 9 trips per day in each direction .
#Text=Get around
#Text=There are 5 local bus lines ( Lines 1 , 2 , 3 , 11 and 12 ) that serve all parts of the city .
#Text=These lines are operated by Metropoline .
#Text=Having said that , Arad can easily be explored on foot .
#Text=See

#Text=Tel Arad National Park ( At the Tel Arad junction on Route 31 ( Arad-Shoket junction ) turn north on Route 2808 - the park is 2 miles north of the junction . ) , ☏ +9727 776-2170 , +972 8-9957 690 , fax : +9727 995-5866 .
#Text=Open April-September 8am-5pm , October-March 8am-4pm .
#Text=The site of the ancient city , well worth a visit from an archaeological point of view .
#Text=The site consists of two parts , the lower city ( from the Bronze Age ) and the upper city ( an Israelite settlement ) .
#Text=₪ 14/12/7 adult/student/child&senior .
#Text=" Eshet Lot " –
#Text=The artists ' quarter
#Text=.
#Text=An exclusive quarter with its own brand of desert atmosphere , combining creativity and artistry is in the heart of the industrial zone , on the road leading down to the Dead Sea .
#Text=The artists , who are all inhabitants of Arad , united together to create a productive community with an enhanced sensitivity towards the environment .
#Text=Arad Visitors Centre ( downtown Arad , close to the mall and community centre ) , ☏ +97207 995-4409 .
#Text=April-September 8am-5pm , October-March 8am-4pm .
#Text=The Israel Nature and National Parks Protection Authority 's visitors centre introduces visitors to the geology and history of the Judaean Desert .
#Text=Its audiovisual program uses water and a 3D model of the Judaean Desert to demonstrate why this desert is so prone to flooding .
#Text=Artifacts from Tel Arad and models of Canaanite Arad and the Israelite-period fortress are on display in the section devoted to history .
#Text=A multi-screen video presentation brings the visitor back to the present and the modern city of Arad .
#Text=The Visitors Centre has information on hiking trails , events and areas of interest in the Judaean Desert .
#Text=Visitors can purchase maps , sheets with suggested hiking routes and related literature .
#Text=adults ₪23 , children ₪12 .
#Text=Yatir Forest .
#Text=One of the biggest forests in Israel and popular in summer for hiking and biking .
#Text=The Israel National Trail runs through the forest and by Tel Arad .
#Text=Moav Lookout .
#Text=Here the Israeli artist Yigal Tumarkin created a big outdoor sculpture in 1968 .
#Text=Camel herds , owned by the local Bedouins , can be spotted along the main road before and after the .
#Text=Do
#Text=There are some hiking destinations east .
#Text=Align with the local tourist information .
#Text=The following lookouts are used as hiking or biking destinations from Arad : and .
#Text=Buy
#Text=The biggest shopping mall , , is located in the centre of the city
#Text=The is famous for its weekly market on Mondays
#Text=Sleep
#Text=There are apparently many private rooms available for rent here – try the usual suspects .
#Text=Budget
#Text=Arad Tandem , Gilad St 21 , ☏ +972 8-9952207 , +972 54-5439980 , ✉ Saltroomarad@gmail.com .
#Text=This is the secret in town .
#Text=Offers a great apartment with 3 rooms ( including private ) and all necessities .
#Text=Book through their website or just call ahead , they are not so firm with online bookings , but you want to make sure it is not fully booked .
#Text=Do n't mind the dog when walking up to their house - there is no sign , you have to walk up on the left side and knock .
#Text=From ₪95 for a bed in a 4 bed room ( supposedly $ 34 during high season , but the website does n't say something like it ) .
#Text=Dead Sea Adventure Hostel , Odem St 68 ( Rotem ) , ☏ +972584960748 , ✉ Deadseaadventurehostel@gmail.com .
#Text=Also offers tours into the surrounding area .
#Text=Dorms from ₪85 .
#Text=Desert Bird Hostel , 28 Bareket St. ( Rotem ) , ☏ +972 72-3902195 , ✉ desertbird2015@gmail.com .
#Text=Another budget option .
#Text=Member of ILH .
#Text=Dorm bed from ₪100 .
#Text=Israel YHA Hostel Arad ( Blau-Weiss Hostel ) , ☏ +972 8-9957150 , ✉ arad@iyha.org.il .
#Text=Book ahead , not to get an expensive private room offered if you arrive late .
#Text=Dorm bed from ₪145 .
#Text=Mid range / Splurge
#Text=Inbar Hotel , 38 Yehuda Street , ☏ +972 8-997-3303 .
#Text=Go next
#Text=Masada – A former Roman fortress on top of a mountain .
#Text=The only road access to the west side of Masada is through Arad .
#Text=This route is popular for those arriving early for sunsets .
#Text=Besides that , Arad is a great location for trips to all directions including :
#Text=Dead Sea – One of the most famous things to see/do in Israel and Jordan .
#Text=Judaean Desert – Visit its various attractions , next to the Dead Sea .
#Text=Beer Sheva – University town , but does not much cater for tourists and especially backpackers .
#Text=Mitzpe Ramon – Great site , hikes and views on the edge of a giant crater .
#Text=Eilat – Holiday town in the far south with border crossings to Jordan and Egypt .
